Defintion: A small program unit that you can use with other modules to make a program. Programmers also refer to modules as subroutines, procedures, functions, and methods.
Data that is accepted by a function sent to it externally when the function is called.
A value that is passed to a function.
“Running” a function at a given stage of execution.
Variables and constants apply only within the module/function in which they are declared.
